In anticipation of an announcment of his presidential run, Trump cancelled plans to be a celebrity driver of the pace car for the 2011 Indy 500.<ref>{{cite news|author=Weir, Tom|title=Donald Trump bows out of Indy 500 pace car role|url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/gameon/post/2011/05/donald-trump-bows-out-of-indy-500-pace-car-role/1|date=May 5, 2011|work=USA Today|publisher=Gannett|accessdate=May 7, 2011}}</ref>
In anticipation of an announcment of his presidential run, Trump cancelled plans to be a celebrity driver of the pace car for the 2011 Indy 500.<ref>{{cite news|author=Weir, Tom|title=Donald Trump bows out of Indy 500 pace car role|url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/gameon/post/2011/05/donald-trump-bows-out-of-indy-500-pace-car-role/1|date=May 5, 2011|work=USA Today|publisher=Gannett|accessdate=May 7, 2011}}</ref>

===Statements regarding presidential candidates===
+
===Statements regarding Obama===
Speaking to an audience in Boca Raton, Florida on April 16, 2011, Trump contended that voter reaction to former United States President [[George W. Bush]]'s performance in office was a reason for the election of his successor [[Barack Obama]], and further that Obama would probably be known as the worst president in U.S. history.<ref>[http://www.cfnews13.com/article/news/2011/april/233988/Donald-Trump:-Obama-will-go-down-as-worst-president-in-U.S.-history Donald Trump: Obama will go down as worst president in U.S. history].''Bright House Networks''. Retrieved April 17, 2011.</ref>
Speaking to an audience in Boca Raton, Florida on April 16, 2011, Trump contended that voter reaction to former United States President [[George W. Bush]]'s performance in office was a reason for the election of his successor [[Barack Obama]], and further that Obama would probably be known as the worst president in U.S. history.<ref>[http://www.cfnews13.com/article/news/2011/april/233988/Donald-Trump:-Obama-will-go-down-as-worst-president-in-U.S.-history Donald Trump: Obama will go down as worst president in U.S. history].''Bright House Networks''. Retrieved April 17, 2011.</ref>
